result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jennifer E Sherman

records.addlTxt:
UNSIGNED
Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
No contact directly or indirectly with the party/parties named in the bail bond, no contact at their residence/property. 
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.

1:35 PM Defendant Jennifer E Sherman appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Christin Marie Saint Pierre appeared by phone for Jennifer E Sherman.  Attorney Claudia T. Johnson appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Bond was not set at IA, but defendant is in custody on child support issue. State requests $500 signature bond w/conditions. Defense does not object. Court sets a $500 signature bond w/conditions as requested by the state.
Bail/bond hearing on October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference on December 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.

3:45 PM Defendant Jennifer E Sherman appeared by phone, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Corey R. Hoze in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Advised of rights. Defendant did not receive copy of complaint. Court reviews charge and penalties with Defendant. Defendant enters a plea of not guilty and request an attorney. Deft informs the Court that she does qualify for public defender representation. Court does not set bond.
